dc:title: On Pilgrimage - November 1956
dc:creator: Dorothy Day

dc:description.P: Depicts the plight of black sharecroppers in Mississippi--efforts to drive them off the land, economic injustice, intimidation, and lack of ownership. Tells of efforts to speak out and organize. Before arriving in the deep south she visits Catholic Workers in Memphis. Keywords: segregation
